title: Unit 8 Checkpoint: Applications of Integration
description: Summative checkpoint assessing area between curves, volume by disk/washer and cross-sections, average value, and motion/accumulation applications.

remediationResources.reteachFocus: ∫[top−bottom]dx or ∫[right−left]dy; find intersection points; sometimes need to switch variable
Disk: π∫R²dx (no hole); Washer: π∫(R²−r²)dx; R=dist from axis to outer, r=dist to inner; choose dx or dy based on axis
V=∫A(x)dx; A depends on cross-section shape (square, semicircle, equilateral Δ); base length from curves
f_avg = (1/(b−a))∫ₐᵇf(x)dx; displacement=∫v dt, distance=∫|v|dt, net change=∫rate dt

assessmentProblems.question: Find the area of the region bounded by y = x² and y = 4.
Find the area between y = x and y = x² on [0, 1].
Find the volume of the solid obtained by revolving y = √x about the x-axis from x = 0 to x = 4.
assessmentProblems.answer: Disk method: V = π∫₀⁴(√x)²dx = π∫₀⁴x dx = π[x²/2]₀⁴ = π(8) = 8π.

assessmentProblems.question: Find the volume of the solid obtained by revolving the region between y = x² and y = √x about the x-axis.
assessmentProblems.answer: Intersections: x²=√x → x⁴=x → x(x³−1)=0 → x=0,1. On [0,1]: √x > x² (outer=√x, inner=x²). Washer: V = π∫₀¹[(√x)²−(x²)²]dx = π∫₀¹(x−x⁴)dx = π[x²/2−x⁵/5]₀¹ = π(1/2−1/5) = 3π/10.

assessmentProblems.question: A solid has its base in the region bounded by y = x and y = x² (for 0 ≤ x ≤ 1). Cross-sections perpendicular to the x-axis are squares. Find the volume.
assessmentProblems.answer: Side length s(x) = x − x². A(x) = s² = (x−x²)². V = ∫₀¹(x−x²)²dx = ∫₀¹(x²−2x³+x⁴)dx = [x³/3−x⁴/2+x⁵/5]₀¹ = 1/3−1/2+1/5 = 10/30−15/30+6/30 = 1/30.

assessmentProblems.question: Find the average value of f(x) = cos(x) on [0, π/2].
A particle has velocity v(t) = t² − 4t + 3 m/s. Find (a) the displacement and (b) the total distance traveled on [0, 4].

ANALYSIS: Water flows into a tank at rate R(t) = 10 + 2sin(t) gallons/min and drains at rate D(t) = 6 gallons/min. At t = 0, the tank contains 50 gallons. (a) Write an expression for the amount of water at time t. (b) Is the amount increasing or decreasing at t = π? (c) Find the amount at t = 2π.

spiralReview.question: SPIRAL (Separation of Variables): Solve dy/dx = 2xy with y(0) = 3.
spiralReview.answer: dy/y = 2x dx → ln|y| = x² + C → y = Ae^(x²). y(0)=3: A=3. y = 3e^(x²).

spiralReview.question: SPIRAL (Integration by Parts): Evaluate ∫ ln(x) dx.
spiralReview.answer: u=ln(x), dv=dx. du=1/x dx, v=x. ∫ln(x)dx = xln(x) − ∫x·(1/x)dx = xln(x) − x + C.
